bwwExcerpt: Solidly played by the orchestra conducted by Will Curry and consistently well sung by the cast, the music is a curious hodgepodge, from forcefully keening laments to catchy if derivative '70s-style pop, such as the opening number "The Heat Is on in Saigon" (conspicuously reminiscent of Randy Newman's "Mama Told Me Not to Come") and syrupy love ballads like "Last Night of the World."
